Write a function to check if a number is prime in TypeScript.

Here's a TypeScript function to check if a number is prime:

function isPrime(n: number): boolean {
  if (n <= 1) return false;
  if (n <= 3) return true;
  if (n % 2 === 0 || n % 3 === 0) return false;

  for (let i = 5; i * i <= n; i += 6) {
    if (n % i === 0 || n % (i + 2) === 0) {
      return false;
    }
  }
  return true;
}

// Usage examples
console.log(isPrime(7));  // true
console.log(isPrime(10)); // false

This implementation uses the 6kÂ±1 optimization for better performance.
